english: surging waves; wave-beating; billowing surf; to stir up waves

etymology.description: 鼓(beat; rouse) + 浪(waves) = waves being beaten up; surging surf.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the sense of drumming/rousing with waves to depict surf stirred into motion or pounding swells. Can be literal (billowing waves) or figurative (stirring up a commotion).

examples.chinese: 海风渐起(海風漸起)，海面鼓浪(海面鼓浪)。
examples.english: As the sea breeze picks up, the water surface heaves with surging waves.

examples.chinese: 台风来临时(颱風來臨時)，巨石被鼓浪拍击(巨石被鼓浪拍擊)。
examples.pinyin: Táifēng láilín shí, jùshí bèi gǔlàng pāijī.
examples.english: When the typhoon arrives, the boulders are pounded by the billowing surf.

examples.chinese: 炮声隆隆(炮聲隆隆)，江水鼓浪奔流(江水鼓浪奔流)。
examples.english: With cannons rumbling, the river surges in wave after wave.
